page.title: 12SANDWICK - FARMING
page.content: I interviewed{MR Fergeson, grazing {clerk.}He said that in North Street they only dip and cut their sheeps wool once a year. They are only allowed 12 adult sheep on their crofts but they can have lots of lambs. Most of the crofters sell their lambs, through{The Highlands and {Islands livestock scheme}and they are sold on the Mainland. Some of the crofters are using suffolk and cheviot rams in order to get heavier lambs. At the moment there are no cattle on North Street but many years ago nearly every family had their own milking cow.
